required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Use of Ultrasound in Assessing Post-prostatectomy Erectile Dysfunction
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound Vibroelastography in Post-Prostatectomy Erectile Dysfunction

brief_summary.textblock: Researchers are trying to determine whether there is additional utility to using vibroelastography, a noninvasive ultrasound technique to evaluate for the presence of tissue fibrosis, in conjunction with standard penile duplex Doppler ultrasound to assess erectile function (recovery) after prostate cancer surgery.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, 3 months, 6 months and 9 months post-prostatectomy

arm_group.arm_group_label: Ultrasound viscoelastography (UVE) in radical proctectomy recovery
arm_group.description: Subjects undergoing radical prostatectomy for prostate cancer disease as standard of care will have a ultrasound vibroelastography performed before surgery, 3 months, 6 months and 9 months post-prostatectomy.

intervention.description: Ultrasound technique to quantitatively assess tissue stiffness (elasticity and viscosity) by applying vibration through a specialized probe (indenter).
intervention.arm_group_label: Ultrasound viscoelastography (UVE) in radical proctectomy recovery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria include:
- Age > 40 years
- Clinically localized prostate cancer (American Urological Association Grade Groups 1-2; cT1c or cT2a-b; PSA < 10) without clinic or imaging evidence of localized extra-prostatic or metastatic disease (i.e. AUA low and favorable intermediate risk prostate cancer)
- International Index of Erectile Function (IIEF) of â‰¥ 21 points at baseline (no or mild erectile dysfunction)
- Patient-expressed interest in consultation for sexual function (erectile function) preservation/ optimization
- Planned bilateral nerves-paring prostatectomy
Exclusion criteria include:
- Moderate or severe ED based in IIEF criteria (score < 21)
- History of prior pelvic or penile surgery
- Current or prior androgen deprivation therapy
- Planned non-nerve sparing prostatectomy
